numbered_ace_sentences: 2. Some applicants have parents or siblings who attended an elite college.
3. Some applicants have a substantially large income.
4. These applicants are accepted faster than a scholar who does not have these requirements.
5. A legacy applicant is an applicant who has a parent or sibling who attended the same elite college.
6. A legacy applicant may have a family member who performed very well.
7. An elite college may choose a safer option.
8. If an elite college accepts a legacy applicant, then the elite status of the college may benefit.
9. If an elite college accepts a legacy applicant, then the college may keep bonds with these families.
10. I wonder how likely it is that an elite college turns down a legacy applicant.
11. I also wonder how likely it is that an elite college chooses a regular applicant over a legacy applicant.
12. This topic relates to my experience at my high school.
13. My high school has blended income rates.
14. Students at my high school have the same opportunities.
15. Students at my high school have the same education.
16. The headline is: Are the same opportunities given to everyone?
